tier.item: "Brother-in-law, you will stay and [to] tell him (the story)." (Douglas 1981:232, ex. 120)
"Brother-in-law, you will stay and [to] tell him (the story)." (Douglas 1981:232, ex. 120)
Brother-in-law, you will stay and [to] tell him (the story).
"He got the boomerang to hit the dog." (Douglas 1981:232, ex. 121)
"He got the boomerang to hit the dog." (Douglas 1981:232, ex. 121)
He got the boomerang to hit the dog.
"I will try to copy, the emu said." (Sharp 1998:229, ex. 48)
"I will try to copy, the emu said." (Sharp 1998:229, ex. 48)
I will try to copy, the emu said.
(5) Ngajulu wika mana-rna-lu mirtawa-ku mayi-ku kampa-na-ku.

(6) Nganyjurru-lu munu nganganya-ku wirtu-jartiny pajali-jartiny kuyi.

Nganyjurru-lu munu nganganya-ku wirtu-jartiny pajali-jartiny kuyi. Pala-ja-lu kuyi mana-nya-ku wupartu-marta-jartiny jinyji-jartiny.

tier.item: Karnta yinti-ku thurla-ngka-nguru. Pirntipirnti-rru thurni-ku parilha.
tear go.down-PRES eye-LOC-ABL apart-NOW laugh-PRES still
Thurni-ku murnalpurlu parilha. Purri-nmayi-ku thurni-ku yirra purranyja.
laugh-PRES close.by still pull-RECIP-PRES laugh-PRES teeth show
"These two (children) are laughing. They are dying laughing. Tears are streaming
from their eyes.Now they are apart, still laughing. Close together they are still
laughing. They're pulling at one another laughing, their teeth showing."
Karnta yinti-ku thurla-ngka-nguru. Pirntipirnti-rru thurni-ku parilha.

from their eyes.Now they are apart, still laughing. Close together they are still

tier.item: (15) Ngunha thurru ngarri-ku mulha purranyja yinta-ka.
that snake lie-PRES nose show pool-LOC
"That snake lies in the pool with just its nose showing. If you go (there), it will bite you."

tier.item: "Those two women are winnowing (the seed), throwing the rubbish away, keeping the
good, and grinding it on a millstone."

good, and grinding it on a millstone."

that-DUAL woman-DUAL winnow-PRES dirty-ACC throw-PRES good-ACC keep-PRES grind-PRES mill-LOC

tier.item: "I was sitting smoothing the point (of a spear). I saw you coming."
"I was sitting smoothing the point (of a spear). I saw you coming."
Ngatha yumpu-yu yurrpi-lku panti-nha. Ngatha wiya-rna nyinku paka-rnu-ku.
I was sitting smoothing the point (of a spear). I saw you coming.
"The clothes are hanging and getting dry." (Kohn 1994, ex. 177)
"The clothes are hanging and getting dry." (Kohn 1994, ex. 177)
The clothes are hanging and getting dry.
This talk is making me tired.
(22) Nyinta ngamun-wuntu paja-lku, ngayi nyarni paja-lku.
"You eat faster than me." (lit : "You eat fast, I eat slow.") (Kohn 1994, ex.176)

tier.item: Pirrpi- lpatharn, pirrpi- lpatharn. Jirli pungka-ku wupu-ngka-pa
scrape HABIT scrape-HABIT spark fall-PRES container-LOC-EMPH
kurna-ngka-pa ngula. Kampa-ku juju-pa. Kampa-ku kurlukurlu.
charcoal-LOC-pa there burn-PRES smoke-pa burn-PRES little
"I (used to) get a stone -- a long thin one. I (used to) scrape it and scrape it. A spark
falls into the container, into the charcoal there. Smoke burns, a little smoke. I get grass,
crush it, crush some grass. I get the coal which is burning, put it on the grass, hold it in
the wind. A flame comes up." (Von Brandenstein, 1970:22-23)
Pirrpi- lpatharn, pirrpi- lpatharn. Jirli pungka-ku wupu-ngka-pa
scrape HABIT scrape-HABIT spark fall-PRES container-LOC-EMPH
kurna-ngka-pa ngula. Kampa-ku juju-pa. Kampa-ku kurlukurlu.
charcoal-LOC-pa there burn-PRES smoke-pa burn-PRES little
"I (used to) get a stone -- a long thin one. I (used to) scrape it and scrape it. A spark
falls into the container, into the charcoal there. Smoke burns, a little smoke. I get grass,
crush it, crush some grass. I get the coal which is burning, put it on the grass, hold it in
the wind. A flame comes up." (Von Brandenstein, 1970:22-23)

Marnta-yi thaka-lpatharn marnta-yi-- wanarra-la kurlukurlu. Pirrpi-lpatharn, pirrpi-lpatharn. Jirli pungka-ku wupu-ngka-pa kurna-ngka-pa ngula. Kampa-ku juju-pa. Kampa-ku kurlukurlu. Thaka-lku warrapa-ku, yurnduraka-lku, yurnduraka-lku warrapa-ku. Kurna-yi thaka-lku kampa-nha-ku, wantha-lku warrapa-la, kanyjini-ku thurta-ngka. Yurralyi-pa karlpa-ku.

I (used to) get a stone -- a long thin one. I (used to) scrape it and scrape it. A spark falls into the container, into the charcoal there. Smoke burns, a little smoke. I get grass, crush it, crush some grass. I get the coal which is burning, put it on the grass, hold it in the wind. A flame comes up.
"Those two sat watching the smoke burning."
"Those two sat watching the smoke burning."
Those two sat watching the smoke burning.
(25) Punyja-lkura ngaja papa. Manyja ngaja. Manya ngajuku papa!
"I want to drink water/I'm ready to drink water. I'm thirsty. Give me water!"
(25) Punyja-lkura ngaja papa. Manyja ngaja. Manya ngajuku papa!
"I want to drink water/I'm ready to drink water. I'm thirsty. Give me water!"
Punyja-lkura ngaja papa. Manyja ngaja. Manya ngajuku papa!
I want to drink water/I'm ready to drink water. I'm thirsty. Give me water!
"Now, I'm ready to eat/I'll eat because I'm hungry."
"Now, I'm ready to eat/I'll eat because I'm hungry."
Now, I'm ready to eat/I'll eat because I'm hungry.
"I want to/I'm going to cook fish, because I'm hungry."
"I want to/I'm going to cook fish, because I'm hungry."
I want to/I'm going to cook fish, because I'm hungry.

tier.item: (28) a. Nguja parti-lamu para, nguja, yapanpa.
b. Yapanpa nguja-ngka wanyja-lku para yapanpa, nguja-ngka.
c. That parta kunyingka-punyjarri, that nother one, that.
d. Wanyji-lku martu, martu wanyji-lku, wanyji-lku martu,
dig-PROSP hole hole dig-PROSP dig-PROSP hole
e. that one much long, makanu martu. You put'em marnta now, pala-ngka.
f. Wanyja-lkura martu-ngka, marnta. Marnta you put'em finish'im.
g. Nguja pulara you put'em kankarni. Parti-la nguja-ngka.
h. You put him nguja-ngka now. When he yinngarra-ngarri-nyjanu-la,
j. You cover 'im up yayin-karta-lu now. Yayin put'em kankarni.
k. And he jarta-lkura kanyji-kujalpa nganyja-ku, jarta-lkura.
l. Parti-la thru-n-thru now. Wanpari parti-la.
a. "You would light a fire for [the emu], fire and hot stones.
b. Then put the stones in the fire for it, hot stones in the fire.
c. That other (fire) is for the ashes, the other one.
d. Then dig a hole, dig a hole, dig a hole,
e. that long, a long hole. Then put the rocks in it.
f. Put the rocks there in the hole. Put the rocks there and finish it off.
g. You put the fire on top. It cooks in the fire.
h. You put it in the fire now. When it's burned down to coals,
i. then you put [the emu] there in the fire.
j. You cover it over with iron now. Put the iron on top.
k. And next you cover the two ends with sand, to cover it over.
l. It cooks through and through now. Cooks well."
(28) a. Nguja parti-lamu para, nguja, yapanpa.

a. Nguja parti-lamu para, nguja, yapanpa. b. Yapanpa nguja-ngka wanyja-lku para yapanpa, nguja-ngka. c. That parta kunyingka-punyjarri, that nother one, that. d. Wanyji-lku martu, martu wanyji-lku, wanyji-lku martu, e. that one much long, makanu martu. You put'em marnta now, pala-ngka. f. Wanyja-lkura martu-ngka, marnta. Marnta you put'em finish'im. g. Nguja pulara you put'em kankarni. Parti-la nguja-ngka. h. You put him nguja-ngka now. When he yinngarra-ngarri-nyjanu-la, i. wanyja-lkura pala-ngka martu-ngka. j. You cover 'im up yayin-karta-lu now. Yayin put'em kankarni. k. And he jarta-lkura kanyji-kujalpa nganyja-ku, jarta-lkura. l. Parti-la thru-n-thru now. Wanpari parti-la.

You would light a fire for [the emu], fire and hot stones. b. Then put the stones in the fire for it, hot stones in the fire. c. That other (fire) is for the ashes, the other one. d. Then dig a hole, dig a hole, dig a hole, e. that long, a long hole. Then put the rocks in it. f. Put the rocks there in the hole. Put the rocks there and finish it off. g. You put the fire on top. It cooks in the fire. h. You put it in the fire now. When it's burned down to coals, i. then you put [the emu] there in the fire. j. You cover it over with iron now. Put the iron on top. k. And next you cover the two ends with sand, to cover it over. l. It cooks through and through now. Cooks well.

tier.item: "They used to pull it out (of the water). It would dry. They would roll it now.
Roll and roll and roll and roll it into a ball. They would make it into a ball now."
"They used to pull it out (of the water). It would dry. They would roll it now.
Roll and roll and roll and roll it into a ball. They would make it into a ball now."
Purri-lkamu-ya. Pujaparri-yamu. Jurrka-lkamu-ya now. Jurrka-lkura, jurrka-lkura, jurrka-lkura, jurrka-lkura, wapurta. Wapurta-ya-lamu-ya now ...
pull-USIT-3pl dry-USIT roll-USIT-3pl roll-PROSP roll-PROSP roll-PROSP roll-PROSP ball ball-CAUS-USIT-3pl
They used to pull it out (of the water). It would dry. They would roll it now. Roll and roll and roll and roll it into a ball. They would make it into a ball now.
